item.title: Safe Area problem
item.dc:creator: @sinzscapeserver sinzscapeserver
item.description:
@sinzscapeserver wrote:

public boolean isInWilderness(int coordX, int coordY, int Type) { if (Type == 1) { if ((coordY >= 3523) && (coordY <= 3967) && (coordX <= 3392) && (coordX >= 2942) || absX >= 3220 && absX <= 3299 && absY >= 3520 && absY <=3548 || absX >= 2250 && absX <= 2296 && absY >= 4676 && absY <=4715) { return true; } } else if (Type == 2) { if ((coordY >= 3512) && (coordY <= 3967) && (coordX <= 3392) && (coordX >= 2942) || absX >= 3104 && absX <= 3115 && absY >= 3694 && absY <= 3698) { return false; } } return false; }

Read full topic

item.title: Safe Area problem
item.dc:creator: @sinzscapeserver sinzscapeserver
item.description:
@sinzscapeserver wrote:

[quote=“strucker, post:10, topic:517480”][quote author=sinzscapeserver link=topic=635738.msg4286585#msg4286585 date=1366425455]

Well add the coords you want and make it return false, booleans can only return two values;
True or False, in this case true would be meaning that YOU ARE in wildy, and FALSE that you aren’t.

|| (absX >= YoursmallestXcoord) && (absX <= BiggestXcoord) && (absY >= SmallestYcoord) && (BiggestYcoord)

can you explain that to me
[/quote]
To make the area safe, you’ll need 4 coordinates, to make a rectangle or a square, so You’ll have two x and two y,
so lets pretend that you have this coords…

x= 5555
x= 5556
y= 5555
y= 5556

So youll put in the smallest x the 5555 and in the biggest the 5556, but in your case you’ll have different coordinates.[/quote]
so how would I set it up in this particular rectangle shape

my code

} else if (Type == 2) {
if ((coordY >= 3512) && (coordY <= 3967) && (coordX <= 3392)
&& (coordX >= 2942) || absX >= 3104 && absX <= 3115 && absY >= 3695 && absY <= 3698) {
return true;
}

item.title: Safe Area problem

item.description:
@sinzscapeserver wrote:

[quote=“strucker, post:6, topic:517480”] public boolean isInWilderness(int coordX, int coordY, int Type) { if (Type == 1) { if ((coordY >= 3523) && (coordY <= 3967) && (coordX <= 3392) && (coordX >= 2942) || absX >= 3220 && absX <= 3299 && absY >= 3520 && absY <=3548 || absX >= 2250 && absX <= 2296 && absY >= 4676 && absY <=4715) { return true; } } else if (Type == 2) { if ((coordY >= 3512) && (coordY <= 3967) && (coordX <= 3392) && (coordX >= 2942) || absX >= 3107 && absX <= 3112 && absY >= 3698 && absY <= 3105) { return true; } } return false; }
The problem is that you were using ( and ) when they weren’t needed
i fixed for you[/quote]
I got it done but can you explain to me how to make the safezone I think I got the X and Y shit wrong.

item.title: Safe Area problem
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

public boolean isInWilderness(int coordX, int coordY, int Type) { if (Type == 1) { if ((coordY >= 3523) && (coordY <= 3967) && (coordX <= 3392) && (coordX >= 2942) || absX >= 3220 && absX <= 3299 && absY >= 3520 && absY <=3548 || absX >= 2250 && absX <= 2296 && absY >= 4676 && absY <=4715) { return true; } } else if (Type == 2) { if ((coordY >= 3512) && (coordY <= 3967) && (coordX <= 3392) && (coordX >= 2942) || absX >= 3107 && absX <= 3112 && absY >= 3698 && absY <= 3105) { return true; } } return false; }
The problem is that you were using ( and ) when they weren’t needed
i fixed for you

first type: boolean
second type: int
